title: Photography

I have put together some of my relics from my travels. As you can see, I love water and will always take a picture of it. As a constant believer of trying new things, I have also attached a picture of my skydiving - something I just think is super cool to mention!

title: Projects
text:
arXiv Preprint | Code
Over the centuries, I have devoted countless hours to deciphering and translating the ancient scripts and dialects of the various peoples of Middle-earth. My goal is to gain a deeper understanding of the cultures and histories of these peoples by studying their languages. Currently, I am working on a monograph that explores the linguistic roots of the Elvish languages. Through extensive research and analysis, I hope to shed light on the connections between the different dialects of Elvish and their origins. This project has been particularly challenging, as Elvish is a complex and nuanced language, but I am determined to see it through to completion.

title: Projects
section: The History of the War of the Ring
text:
The History of the War of the Ring

arXiv Preprint | Code
I am creating a comprehensive and detailed history of the conflict that goes beyond the surface-level events. By gathering information from a variety of sources, including my own memories, written accounts, and oral histories, I hope to shed new light on this important period in Middle-earth’s history and provide valuable insights into the motivations and actions of the various players involved.

title: Nice to meet you!
text:
Nice to meet you!
I am currently a 4th year at Case Western Reserve University from New York City pursuing a degree in Computer Science, along with a Master’s in Biostatistics through an integrated program. I am particularly interested in the combination of biology and data analysis, specifically utilizing computational algorithms to gain further knowledge in the molecular mechanisms underlying disease progression and transmission.
This past summer, I interned at AWS on the Invoice Compliance team. My project focused on developing a data-visualization website that enabled the team to quickly search for individual invoices and identify issues without having to manually sift through large amounts of data, as well as give statistic summaries so that the stakeholders could make quick and informed decisions.
Outside of my academic endeavors, I love to dance, serving as the Treasurer of my collegiate dance team, working to manage our budget and oversee the operations of all the events, successfully raising money to support our team’s travel to out of state dance competitions. I also love to travel with my roommate. Together, we have traveled to so many new cities, learning more about the culture, exploring our palettes, and trying new things.
I am eager to further advance both my academic and professional journey, gaining both knowledge and experience along the way. Please feel free to contact me at contact me.
